definition: to have an audience (with the Emperor)
abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards
morning
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: I had a private audience with the King, and made a proposition.
sentences.chinese: 我私下朝见国王，向他陈言献策。

sentences.english: Thrice in the year shall all your menchildren appear before the LORD God， the God of Israel.
sentences.chinese: 你们一切男丁要一年三次朝见主耶和华以色列的神。

sentences.english: Do this at the appointed time in the month of Abib, for in that month you came out of Egypt. "No one is to appear before me empty-handed.
sentences.chinese: 谁也不可空手朝见我，因为你是这月出了埃及。

sentences.english: They go from strength to strength, the God of gods will be seen in Zion.
sentences.chinese: 他们行走，力上加力，各自到锡安朝见神。

sentences.english: When can I go and meet with God?
No one is to appear before me empty-handed.
Come and behold Him, Born the King of Angels;
sentences.chinese: 来朝见圣婴，天使君王降生。

sentences.english: Oh, come and behold Him, born the King of angels.
sentences.chinese: 齐来，朝见天使之王降临。

sentences.english: I go in state to court meet the queen.
sentences.chinese: 我正式上宫廷朝见女王。

sentences.english: Three times a year all your men are to appear before the Sovereign Lord , the God of Israel.
sentences.chinese: 你们一切男丁，要一年三次朝见主耶和华以色列的神。

sentences.english: Wherewith shall I come before the LORD, and bow myself before the high God?
sentences.chinese: 我朝见耶和华，在至高神面前跪拜，当献上什么呢。

definition: to have an audience (with the Emperor)
to give audience (of emperor)/retainers' duty to pay respect to sovereign/hajj (Islam)
to have an audience with
to present tribute (to the emperor)
to worship/to make customary deferences to/a pilgrimage
the (rightful) emperor/"Son of Heaven" (traditional English translation)
to have an audience (with the emperor)
civil and military officials
to receive an imperial command
issue a decree
(diplomatic) envoy
call in (one's subordinates)/summon (an envoy of a foreign country) to an interview
to dispatch an envoy
official in feudal court/subject
to offer as tribute
to confer a title upon sb/to dub/to crown/to invest with rank or title
